title: Dual number
summary: In algebra, the dual numbers are a hypercomplex number system first introduced in the 19th century. They are expressions of the form a + bε, where a and b are real numbers, and ε is a symbol taken to satisfy ε 2 = 0 {\displaystyle \varepsilon ^{2}=0} with ε ≠ 0 {\displaystyle \varepsilon \neq 0} .
